bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: xemacs fails when using AUC-TeX on TeX files.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): xemacs-21.5.34-18.20161013hg39f002ba1b8c.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. xemacs -q /tmp/xxx.tex # No such file 2. 3.
Actual results: In the echo area: Fontifying xxx.tex... abort.aborted
Expected results:
Additional info: When opening an existing file, the message is "Fontifying region... (invalid regexp Unmatched ( or \()", same when calling e.g. "C-c s" (enter a section heading).

anyone know a workaround? how can i help?
currently, i have to something else than xemacs for .tex editing, which is rather annoying.

Sorry, I've been dealing with packages that didn't work at all, so a package that mostly works but has a bug was further down my list. It looks like this bug is due to defface declarations that include a :height specifier, in font-latex.el. I'm not sure what to do about that, so I've asked the other XEmacs developers for advice. Let me see what they have to say, and we'll get a solution for this put together.

(In reply to jan p. springer from comment #1) > anyone know a workaround? how can i help? > > currently, i have to something else than xemacs for .tex editing, which is > rather annoying.
GNU emacs somewhat works, but currently AUC-TeX has the annoying bug that C-c C-r and C-c C-b fail.

(In reply to Jerry James from comment #2) > Sorry, I've been dealing with packages that didn't work at all, so a package > that mostly works but has a bug was further down my list. It looks like > this bug is due to defface declarations that include a :height specifier, in > font-latex.el. I'm not sure what to do about that, so I've asked the other > XEmacs developers for advice. Let me see what they have to say, and we'll > get a solution for this put together.
AUC-TeX doesn't "mostly work", it doesn't work at all.

(In reply to Horst H. von Brand from comment #4) > AUC-TeX doesn't "mostly work", it doesn't work at all.
I mean that xemacs mostly works. I was referring to Fedora packages.
xemacs-21.5.34-19.20170114hgd0e8ec0fe015.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b8e4615040

xemacs-21.5.34-19.20170114hgd0e8ec0fe015.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b8e4615040
unfortunately, the above update doesn't fix the problem
xemacs-21.5.34-19.20170114hgd0e8ec0fe015.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
For the information of those plagued by this bug, the offending commit to the mercurial repository has been identified. We are currently working on a fix.
